Comment.origin: [a published in the Yale Law Review]

sub_terms.a: an essay analyzing, criticizing, or explaining a subject [a published in the Yale Law Review]
sub_terms.b: an explanatory remark appended to a section of text (as of enacted code)

2.definition: an expression of an opinion or attitude about something

sub_terms.a: a remark to a jury by a judge or prosecutor about evidence
sub_terms.b: a written expression of opinion or information solicited by an agency about a subject of its rulemaking see also

2.note: A prosecutor may not remark to the jury that a defendant's failure to testify implies guilt, and a judge may not remark to the jury his or her opinion about what the evidence does or does not prove.
